"}, {'number': 10, 'created': '2018-10-02 15:46:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/8600a4b233ab267ac39f7883e746a2ce007865e6', 'message': "conf: Add three new '[libvirt] live_migration_*' options

Nova uses libvirt-python's migrateToUri3 function, which is a wrapper
around the virDomainMigrateToURI3 [2] C function, to live migrate
instances. As the name would suggest, this function requires a
destination URI and the format of that URI can vary by hypervisor and
deployment.

In order to live migrate an instance, nova needs to generate this
destination URI. To do this, nova can generate a URI that is suitable
for the configured hypervisor assuming an otherwise default
configuration. This is expected to cover 90% of use cases but the URI
generated may not be suitable for deployments with non-default
configuration, such as those using libvirt with a transport other than
TCP. To support these deployments, nova has historically used the
'[libvirt] live_migration_uri' configuration option, which allowed
deployers to specify a templated URI string which nova could then
populate with the destination hostname or IP. For example:

  [libvirt]
  live_migration_uri = qemu+ssh://myuser@%%s/system

This requires the user to fully define the URI, ignoring nova's
(admittedly minimal) smarts here, even if they only wished to override
one component of the URI. More importantly though, as seen above, this
used printf-style string formatting and, due to a quirk in
'oslo.config', required escaping of the formatting characters ('%%'
instead of '%'). This was a common source of user-error that was not
possible to resolve without breaking changes to the option. As a result,
the '[libvirt] live_migration_scheme' option was added, which allowed
users to modify nova's auto-generated URIs slightly to reflect their
chosen transport, without having to resort to the 'live_migration_uri'
configuration option.

Unfortunately, while different transports are now handled (and hostname is
handled by nova), we do not handle the three other components of a URI:
username, port, and extra parameters.

  driver[+transport]://[username@][hostname][:port]/[path][?extraparameters]

As a result, it is not yet possible to remove '[libvirt]
live_migration_uri'. To resolve this issue and close the gap, we must
add three new live migration options to the '[libvirt]' group to
complement the existing 'live_migration_scheme' option.

- live_migration_username
- live_migration_port
- live_migration_extra_params

The combination of these options will allow full configuration of the
live migration URI without incurring the issues caused by '[libvirt]
live_migration_uri' and allow us to finally deprecated that option in a
future release.

The help text for existing options is clarified.

[1] https://libvirt.org/html/libvirt-libvirt-domain.html#virDomainMigrateToURI3

Change-Id: I122850d73ff89f6fd611a08446311ba6e0e9d9cd
Closes-Bug: #1671288
Related-Bug: #1677913

"}, {'number': 14, 'created': '2020-05-06 14:06:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/7444b1e7b352babcae81b2ecbfaa189cc629e720', 'message': "conf: Add three new '[libvirt] live_migration_*' options

Nova uses libvirt-python's migrateToUri3 function, which is a wrapper
around the virDomainMigrateToURI3 [2] C function, to live migrate
instances. As the name would suggest, this function requires a
destination URI and the format of that URI can vary by hypervisor and
deployment.

In order to live migrate an instance, nova needs to generate this
destination URI. To do this, nova can generate a URI that is suitable
for the configured hypervisor assuming an otherwise default
configuration. This is expected to cover 90% of use cases but the URI
generated may not be suitable for deployments with non-default
configuration, such as those using libvirt with a transport other than
TCP. To support these deployments, nova has historically used the
'[libvirt] live_migration_uri' configuration option, which allowed
deployers to specify a templated URI string which nova could then
populate with the destination hostname or IP. For example:

  [libvirt]
  live_migration_uri = qemu+ssh://myuser@%s/system

This requires the user to fully define the URI, ignoring nova's
(admittedly minimal) smarts here, even if they only wished to override
one component of the URI. More importantly though, as seen above, this
used printf-style string formatting and required escaping of the
formatting characters ('%%' instead of '%') so that %foo doesn't get
recognized as a format argument. This was a common source of user-error
that was not possible to resolve without breaking changes to the option.
As a result, the '[libvirt] live_migration_scheme' option was added,
which allowed users to modify nova's auto-generated URIs slightly to
reflect their chosen transport, without having to resort to
the 'live_migration_uri' configuration option.

Unfortunately, while different transports are now handled (and hostname is
handled by nova), we do not handle the three other components of a URI:
username, port, and extra parameters.

  driver[+transport]://[username@][hostname][:port]/[path][?extraparameters]

As a result, it is not yet possible to remove '[libvirt]
live_migration_uri'. To resolve this issue and close the gap, we must
add four new live migration options to the '[libvirt]' group to
complement the existing 'live_migration_scheme' option.

- live_migration_username
- live_migration_port
- live_migration_path
- live_migration_extra_params

The combination of these options will allow full configuration of the
live migration URI without incurring the issues caused by '[libvirt]
live_migration_uri' and allow us to finally deprecate that option in a
future release.

The help text for existing options is clarified.

[1] https://libvirt.org/html/libvirt-libvirt-domain.html#virDomainMigrateToURI3

Change-Id: I122850d73ff89f6fd611a08446311ba6e0e9d9cd

configuration, such as those using libvirt with a transport other than
TCP. To support these deployments, nova has historically used the
'[libvirt] live_migration_uri' configuration option, which allowed
deployers to specify a templated URI string which nova could then
populate with the destination hostname or IP. For example:

  [libvirt]
  live_migration_uri = qemu+ssh://myuser@%s/system

This requires the user to fully define the URI, ignoring nova's
(admittedly minimal) smarts here, even if they only wished to override
one component of the URI. More importantly though, as seen above, this
used printf-style string formatting and required escaping of the
formatting characters ('%%' instead of '%') so that %foo doesn't get
recognized as a format argument. This was a common source of user-error
that was not possible to resolve without breaking changes to the option.
As a result, the '[libvirt] live_migration_scheme' option was added,
which allowed users to modify nova's auto-generated URIs slightly to
reflect their chosen transport, without having to resort to
the 'live_migration_uri' configuration option.

Unfortunately, while different transports are now handled (and hostname is
handled by nova), we do not handle the three other components of a URI:
username, port, and extra parameters.

  driver[+transport]://[username@][hostname][:port]/[path][?extraparameters]

As a result, it is not yet possible to remove '[libvirt]
live_migration_uri'. To resolve this issue and close the gap, we must
add four new live migration options to the '[libvirt]' group to
complement the existing 'live_migration_scheme' option.

- live_migration_username
- live_migration_port
- live_migration_path
- live_migration_extra_params

The combination of these options will allow full configuration of the
live migration URI without incurring the issues caused by '[libvirt]
live_migration_uri' and allow us to finally deprecate that option in a
future release.

The help text for existing options is clarified.

[1] https://libvirt.org/html/libvirt-libvirt-domain.html#virDomainMigrateToURI3

Change-Id: I122850d73ff89f6fd611a08446311ba6e0e9d9cd
Closes-Bug: #1671288
Closes-Bug: #1843883
Related-Bug: #1677913

commit_message:
conf: Add four new '[libvirt] live_migration_*' options

Nova uses libvirt-python's migrateToUri3 function, which is a wrapper
around the virDomainMigrateToURI3 [2] C function, to live migrate
instances. As the name would suggest, this function requires a
destination URI and the format of that URI can vary by hypervisor and
deployment.

In order to live migrate an instance, nova needs to generate this
destination URI. To do this, nova can generate a URI that is suitable
for the configured hypervisor assuming an otherwise default
configuration. This is expected to cover 90% of use cases but the URI
generated may not be suitable for deployments with non-default
configuration, such as those using libvirt with a transport other than
TCP. To support these deployments, nova has historically used the
'[libvirt] live_migration_uri' configuration option, which allowed
deployers to specify a templated URI string which nova could then
populate with the destination hostname or IP. For example:

  [libvirt]
  live_migration_uri = qemu+ssh://myuser@%s/system

This requires the user to fully define the URI, ignoring nova's
(admittedly minimal) smarts here, even if they only wished to override
one component of the URI. More importantly though, as seen above, this
used printf-style string formatting and required escaping of the
formatting characters ('%%' instead of '%') so that %foo doesn't get
recognized as a format argument. This was a common source of user-error
that was not possible to resolve without breaking changes to the option.
As a result, the '[libvirt] live_migration_scheme' option was added,
which allowed users to modify nova's auto-generated URIs slightly to
reflect their chosen transport, without having to resort to
the 'live_migration_uri' configuration option.

Unfortunately, while different transports are now handled (and hostname is
handled by nova), we do not handle the three other components of a URI:
username, port, and extra parameters.

  driver[+transport]://[username@][hostname][:port]/[path][?extraparameters]

As a result, it is not yet possible to remove '[libvirt]
live_migration_uri'. To resolve this issue and close the gap, we must
add four new live migration options to the '[libvirt]' group to
complement the existing 'live_migration_scheme' option.

- live_migration_username
- live_migration_port
- live_migration_path
- live_migration_extra_params

The combination of these options will allow full configuration of the
live migration URI without incurring the issues caused by '[libvirt]
live_migration_uri' and allow us to finally deprecate that option in a
future release.

The help text for existing options is clarified.

[1] https://libvirt.org/html/libvirt-libvirt-domain.html#virDomainMigrateToURI3

Change-Id: I122850d73ff89f6fd611a08446311ba6e0e9d9cd
Closes-Bug: #1671288
Closes-Bug: #1843883
Related-Bug: #1677913
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/71/456571/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: advanced=True,An advanced option that provides complete control over the default libvirt live migration target URI. The ``live_migration_scheme`` and ``live_migration_inbound_addr`` options provide additional logic, such as selecting a suitable default driver and transport, and should be preferred where possible. The format of this string is provided in the `libvirt documentation <https://libvirt.org/remote.html#Remote_URI_reference>`_. Any included ``%s`` is replaced with the migration target hostname. For example:: qemu+ssh://nova@%s/system?keyfile=/var/lib/nova/.ssh/id_rsa&no_tty=1 If this option is set to None (which is the default), Nova will default to using the ``live_migration_scheme`` and ``live_migration_inbound_addr`` options.
deleted_lines: deprecated_for_removal=True, deprecated_since="15.0.0", deprecated_reason=""" live_migration_uri is deprecated for removal in favor of two other options that allow to change live migration scheme and target URI: ``live_migration_scheme`` and ``live_migration_inbound_addr`` respectively. """,Override the default libvirt live migration target URI (which is dependent on virt_type). Any included "%s" is replaced with the migration target hostname. If this option is set to None (which is the default), Nova will automatically generate the `live_migration_uri` value based on only 3 supported `virt_type` in following list: * 'kvm': 'qemu+tcp://%s/system' * 'qemu': 'qemu+tcp://%s/system' * 'xen': 'xenmigr://%s/system'

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for unmaintained/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as unmaintained/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I49bd184077e791ed6be9b949dbcf67955351ddb8

commit_message:
Fix 'cinder-backup' service when Swift with TLS enabled

The 'backup_swift_ca_cert_file' [1] setting is ignored by the Swift
backup driver so 'cinder-backup' service will appear "down" early on
startup when TLS backend used. This change fixes the issue.

1. https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/configuration/block-storage/backup/swift-backup-driver.html

Closes-Bug: #2051985
Change-Id: Idec29ce596438a7969ea32d48bacfede84f5b0b6
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit e99afcafe8d33624b9a695b1f7576ad0e8e5354f)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for unmaintained/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as unmaintained/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-04-15 14:37:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/5edabaf5f3c08efbcc039d5228e3af1781915b60', 'message': "post-2023.1: Remove keystone admin endpoint bits

This backport has been updated to include explicit removal of the admin
endpoint, and should be applied to both Bobcat and Antelope.

In the Zed release kolla-ansible stopped creating the Keystone admin
endpoint by default. Operators were instructed to remove the endpoint
manually or set keystone_create_admin_endpoint to keep it during Zed.

The following condition was used to determine whether to create an admin
endpoint:

  kolla_action == 'upgrade' or keystone_create_admin_endpoint | bool

This was intended to be removed in Antelope, but remained in the code
until removed [1] during the Caracal cycle. This means that if an
operator removes the admin endpoint after upgrading to Zed, Kolla
Ansible will recreate it when upgrading to Antelope or Bobcat.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/904396

Closes-Bug: #2052298

commit_message:
post-2023.1: Remove keystone admin endpoint bits

This backport has been updated to include explicit removal of the admin
endpoint, and should be applied to both Bobcat and Antelope.

In the Zed release kolla-ansible stopped creating the Keystone admin
endpoint by default. Operators were instructed to remove the endpoint
manually or set keystone_create_admin_endpoint to keep it during Zed.

The following condition was used to determine whether to create an admin
endpoint:

  kolla_action == 'upgrade' or keystone_create_admin_endpoint | bool

This was intended to be removed in Antelope, but remained in the code
until removed [1] during the Caracal cycle. This means that if an
operator removes the admin endpoint after upgrading to Zed, Kolla
Ansible will recreate it when upgrading to Antelope or Bobcat.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/904396

Closes-Bug: #2052298
Change-Id: I27028ffae26a57d510e1a78c38ead2f925396e81
(cherry picked from commit 982c4d5e5f9d0dadefaf10c863fb520b47c46930)
(cherry picked from commit 1b6c1cb3dbca39185dd2e76b907c26ce7d3aa12e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/03/915803/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function test_keystone_admin_endpoint { echo "TESTING: Keystone admin endpoint removal" if [[ $(openstack endpoint list --service keystone --interface admin -f value | wc -l) -ne 0 ]]; then echo "ERROR: Found Keystone admin endpoint" exit 1 fi echo "SUCCESS: Keystone admin endpoint removal" } test_keystone_admin_endpoint

commit_message:
ceilometer: Fix wrong rendering of ignore_projects

The ignore_projects option is not a multi-valued option but accepts
only comma-separated strings.

Change-Id: I7977ea4c84417078457afb0d0834934ba5481e5d
(cherry picked from commit e751dda37b549d26f4bf5c097e7d1ce8f1aa08b4)

commit_message:
Add nova::compute::libvirt::secret_ceph resource

This adds the nova::compute::libvirt::secret_ceph
resource definition that can be used to define
libvirt secrets of ceph type.

Before this patch one could only handle one libvirt
secret by configuring the parameters in the
nova::compute::rbd class and with this one can
configure multiple.

This adds a new manage_libvirt_secret parameter
defaulting to true in the nova::compute::rbd class
so that one can disable the creation of the libvirt
secret from that class.

Change-Id: Ief031f5dd4b0648d5629789cb7d6d2f6f946fbf8
(cherry picked from commit a7498d6dbc76349d76a800f7b2e01f1ae29d6115)

commit_message:
magnum: Add manage_tests_packages

The manage_tests_packages parameter exists in the base tempest class
but the same functionality is not implemented in the separate class
for magnum-tempest-plugin.

Introduce the parameter to the magnum class so that users can disable
package management completely.

Change-Id: Id06fd565371c01d3a6c3bee0366314030d287a5f
(cherry picked from commit 40fcf16ba88d60920814bb3bb1d37f5017db5eed)

It looks like the move to unmaintained branching might have finally
done in the bulk of our tempest testing on this branch.

Some tests still work, but basically all tempest related jobs
are trying to pull in Xena stuffs without explicit config.

At this point, the value of the branch is to receieve critical
fixes being backported, and we've decided to drop the bulk of

Change-Id: Ia45d7bc8e033034c14061786b95b4f47f20268d0
"}]
commit_message:
[stable-only] wallaby: Reduce CI jobs

It looks like the move to unmaintained branching might have finally
done in the bulk of our tempest testing on this branch.

Some tests still work, but basically all tempest related jobs
are trying to pull in Xena stuffs without explicit config.

At this point, the value of the branch is to receieve critical
fixes being backported, and we've decided to drop the bulk of
the testing to match the status as we don't see fixing devstack
tempest invocation as critical to meet the branch's status.

Change-Id: Ia45d7bc8e033034c14061786b95b4f47f20268d0

subject: [requirements] Transition Zed to Unmaintained
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-04-19 15:09:21.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/zed/requirements.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/commit/99cd6e6ca84dd0effd2aa9f4e997c67bd6dc429e', 'message': '[requirements] Transition Zed to Unmaintained

This branch reached the end of its official stable maintained period,
hence this patch transition stable/zed branch to Unmaintained. (For
details about Unmaintained state please see: [1][2])

The transitions is as follows:
- tip of the stable/zed branch is tagged with zed-eom tag
- unmaintained/zed branch will be cut from zed-eom tag
- stable/zed branch will be deleted

Note:
- there will no longer be official releases off of zed branch after this
  transition
- backports can be pushed to unmaintained/yoga branch
- openstack-unmaintained-core (or <project>-unmaintained-core groups if
  such exists) have the rights to merge patches

Important: please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final Zed stable release with
backports currently in flight that we should wait for. For the latter
case, please propose a final Zed stable release patch, and rebase this
patch on top of that, with the latest commit hash of stable/zed.

The transition deadline is May 2nd, 2024. [3]

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#unmaintained
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20230724-unmaintained-branches.html
[3] https://releases.openstack.org

Change-Id: I1436f982567f79d5ebb8f0204e5bb764cc75e701
'}]
commit_message:
[requirements] Transition Zed to Unmaintained

This branch reached the end of its official stable maintained period,
hence this patch transition stable/zed branch to Unmaintained. (For
details about Unmaintained state please see: [1][2])

The transitions is as follows:
- tip of the stable/zed branch is tagged with zed-eom tag
- unmaintained/zed branch will be cut from zed-eom tag
- stable/zed branch will be deleted

Note:
- there will no longer be official releases off of zed branch after this
  transition
- backports can be pushed to unmaintained/yoga branch
- openstack-unmaintained-core (or <project>-unmaintained-core groups if
  such exists) have the rights to merge patches

Important: please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final Zed stable release with
backports currently in flight that we should wait for. For the latter
case, please propose a final Zed stable release patch, and rebase this
patch on top of that, with the latest commit hash of stable/zed.

The transition deadline is May 2nd, 2024. [3]

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#unmaintained
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20230724-unmaintained-branches.html
[3] https://releases.openstack.org

Change-Id: I1436f982567f79d5ebb8f0204e5bb764cc75e701

commit_message:
Ensure [molds] password is not logged

The [molds] password option accepts a secret value apparently. So its
value should not appear in debug logs.

Change-Id: If8a54c1d4f74516f1c24f7286e76955b2e424f5c

commit_message:
Remove verify_contents for nova::compute::provider tests

When we updated bundler these tests using verify_contents
started failing, we remove them for now as Zed will
transition to unmaintained soon.

Change-Id: I5e2445d0b9c6dd20fe9d34f7af37e3c9f835e604

subject: hardware: Fix image_meta.id within get_mem_encryption_constraint
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2024-01-05 09:49:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/cf831bd9513ed464bcf290dc586e71dc57c4dd82', 'message': 'Add id and name key when getting image_meta from volume

When creating a volume booted instance with memory enryption
enabled, it may call get_image_metadata_from_volume to get
image_meta, which will result in image_meta without id key.
Therefore, when calling get_mem_encryption_constraint, using
image_meta.id will will cause an error.
Closes-Bug: #2041511
Related-Bug: #2047399
Change-Id: Id4a9d3972589ed7f1c21ffbe0a13d61136b73470
Signed-off-by: songjie <songjie_yewu@cmss.chinamobile.com>
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2024-01-05 12:46:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/31ebee8fa45404cca387e8db046cbd8756c04134', 'message': 'Add id and name key when getting image_meta from volume

When creating a volume booted instance with memory encryption
enabled, it may call get_image_metadata_from_volume to get
image_meta, which will result in image_meta without id key.
Therefore, when calling get_mem_encryption_constraint, using
image_meta.id will cause an error.
Closes-Bug: #2041511
Related-Bug: #2047399
Change-Id: Id4a9d3972589ed7f1c21ffbe0a13d61136b73470
Signed-off-by: songjie <songjie_yewu@cmss.chinamobile.com>
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2024-01-13 07:16:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/17fae6789bb71ac783ac1ed48d725b7569391fdf', 'message': "hardware: Fix image_meta.id within get_mem_encryption_constraint

In get_mem_encryption_constraint, image_meta.id may not exist.
For example, a volume booted instance. So we check whether the
id exists. If there is no value, we set it to a sentinel value
that can be detected later. i.e. '<no id>', as Sean suggested.
Closes-Bug: #2041511
Related-Bug: #2047399
Change-Id: Id4a9d3972589ed7f1c21ffbe0a13d61136b73470
Signed-off-by: songjie <songjie_yewu@cmss.chinamobile.com>

id exists. If there is no value, we set it to a sentinel value
that can be detected later. i.e. '<no id>', as Sean suggested.
Closes-Bug: #2041511
Related-Bug: #2047399
Change-Id: Id4a9d3972589ed7f1c21ffbe0a13d61136b73470
Signed-off-by: songjie <songjie_yewu@cmss.chinamobile.com>
"}]
commit_message:
hardware: Fix image_meta.id within get_mem_encryption_constraint

In get_mem_encryption_constraint, image_meta.id may not exist.
For example, a volume booted instance. So we check whether the
id exists. If there is no value, we set it to a sentinel value
that can be detected later. i.e. '<no id>', as Sean suggested.
Closes-Bug: #2041511
Related-Bug: #2047399
Change-Id: Id4a9d3972589ed7f1c21ffbe0a13d61136b73470
Signed-off-by: songjie <songjie_yewu@cmss.chinamobile.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/97/904197/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(jie): When creating a volume booted instance with memory # enryption enabled, image_meta needs id key. See bug 2041511. if attr == 'image_id' and val: image_meta['id'] = val if attr == 'image_name' and val: image_meta['name'] = val

commit_message:
Fix AttributeError in delete_limit method

This commit resolves an issue in the delete_limit method of the
Identity V3 Proxy class. The method was incorrectly trying to
access a 'Limit' attribute of a 'Limit' object, causing an
AttributeError. The fix involves correctly passing the 'Limit'
class from the '_limit' module as the first argument to the
'_delete' method.

Closes-Bug: #2052650
Change-Id: I435f52f8085c899fe1be57fcd5a2ce6f04618427
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/02/908402/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Set become when install package; change tenant name in tests

installed.
Also changed way to verify the logscraper and logsender service
if are running to be more generic.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-11-11 18:11:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/8823b5fe6a16ed299f9b09342750081ad2329aef', 'message': 'WIP: cloud: Do not reference other cloud mixin's methods

API. However, this is not a true mixin pattern since each of the

only there to allow us to split up the otherwise giant 'Connection'
object. Unfortunately this pattern doesn't really work with type
checkers or language servers since there's no obvious way to identify
where the additional resources are coming from until they're combined in
the 'Connection' class. Fixing this will require multiple steps, but the
first it to remove all dependencies between the various service mixins.
As such, rather than depending on e.g. the 'get_volume' cloud method in
various compute-related cloud methods, we use the 'find_volume' proxy
method. A later chance can then add these various proxy attributes,
exposing them.

commit_message:
cloud: Do not reference other cloud mixin's methods

We are using a mixin-like pattern to construct the cloud layer of our
API. However, this is not a true mixin pattern since each of the
"mixins" have dependencies on each other and to be honest, it's really
only there to allow us to split up the otherwise giant 'Connection'
object. Unfortunately this pattern doesn't really work with type
checkers or language servers since there's no obvious way to identify
where the additional resources are coming from until they're combined in
the 'Connection' class. Fixing this will require multiple steps, but the
first it to remove all dependencies between the various service mixins.
As such, rather than depending on e.g. the 'get_volume' cloud method in
various compute-related cloud methods, we use the 'find_volume' proxy
method. A later change can then add these various proxy attributes,
exposing them.

Change-Id: I10d3782899ac519f715d771d83303990a8289f04
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
cloud: Trivial fixes

Before we combine the various nova-net/neutron common network functions
address a few nits around return statement indentation and docstring
wrapping.

Change-Id: I992673d30225c6639012fd4add91e86ac5e72966
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix list of server migrations

the _list method goes straight through to formatting base_path with attrs,
and for server migrations the attr in the base path is server_uuid,
not server_id.

This patch fixes the base_path of the ServerMigration resource
to use server_id stanza.

Change-Id: I44335a22846f1a11ba60e8bb758b10c39e728897
Story: 2010633
Task: 47591
(cherry picked from commit 8c988b7e627ef802c019979c26fd5cac24871473)

commit_message:
Add support for location apis

This change adds support for below glance apis,
1. Location Add
2. Location Update
3. Location Delete

Change-Id: I8352cc54976dc231841dd8f7cc6ae8a20269a3d9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/71/906471/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def location_add(self, image, url, metadata=None, validation_data=None): """Add location to an image :param image: Either the ID of a image or a :class:`~openstack.image.v2.image.Image` instance. :param url: A valid location url :param metdata: Metadata associated with the location. : validation_data: Values to be used to populate the corresponding image properties. :returns: The updated image :rtype: :class:`~openstack.image.v2.image.Image` """ if not url: raise exceptions.InvalidRequest( "Location url is required to add the location to image." ) if not metadata: metadata = {} image = self._get_resource(_image.Image, image) return image.location_add( self, url=url, meta=metadata, validation_data=validation_data ) def _get_image_with_locations_or_fail(self, image_id): image = self.get_image(image_id) if getattr(image, 'locations', None) is None: raise exceptions.BadRequestException( 'The administrator has disabled API access to' ' image locations' ) return image def location_update(self, image_id, url, metadata=None): """Update an existing location entry in an image's list of locations. The URL specified must be already present in the image's list of locations. :param image_id: ID of image whose location is to be updated. :param url: URL of the location to update. :param metadata: Metadata associated with the location. :returns: The updated image """ image = self._get_image_with_locations_or_fail(image_id) url_map = dict([(loc['url'], loc) for loc in image.locations]) if url not in url_map: raise exceptions.ResourceNotFound( 'Unknown URL: %s, the URL must be one of' ' existing locations of current image' % url ) if not metadata: metadata = {} if url_map[url]['metadata'] == metadata: return image url_map[url]['metadata'] = metadata return image.location_update(self, **url_map) def location_delete(self, image_id, url_set): """Remove one or more location entries of an image. :param image_id: ID of image from which locations are to be removed. :param url_set: set of URLs of location entries to remove. :returns: None """ image = self._get_image_with_locations_or_fail(image_id) current_urls = [loc['url'] for loc in image.locations] missing_locs = url_set.difference(set(current_urls)) if missing_locs: raise exceptions.ResourceNotFound( 'Unknown URL(s): %s' % list(missing_locs) ) url_indices = [current_urls.index(url) for url in url_set] url_indices.sort(reverse=True) return image.location_delete(self, url_indices)

commit_message:
Fix incorrect condition in kolla_container_facts

Incorrect condition in Podman part prevented the retrieval
of facts of all the containers when no names were provided.

Closes-Bug: #2058492
Change-Id: I6d7f7ca0523eb17c7d9a9b93d2037bf77f2c2a47
Signed-off-by: Martin Hiner <martin.hiner@tietoevry.com>
(cherry picked from commit a7c8bcda2e8b3c9d218555349d0440a9c9232fa1)

commit_message:
mariadb: fix cluster recovery

sometimes cluster recovery didn't work
because we only look for the sequence number in the last 200 lines
of the log file.

fix this by ingesting the complete file and only register the last
sequence number we find.

Closes-Bug: 1821173

Change-Id: Iea2661c9d5d262cf99edd5f5b567f252607a0003
Signed-off-by: Sven Kieske <kieske@osism.tech>
(cherry picked from commit 984cb0a7543e3b78f8e7e5b3ef33bc3bd3ce690a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/51/916451/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: shell: awk -F" " '/Recovered position/{seqno=$NF} END{split(seqno, a, ":"); print a[2]}' /tmp/mariadb_tmp.log

"}, {'number': 17, 'created': '2023-03-20 23:20:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/b23a6195f11651a7c1b7923d68b4613317b973c8', 'message': "Add X-Open-Expired to recover expired objects

When a client sets a 'x-open-expired' header to a true value for a
GET/HEAD request the proxy will forward x-backend-open-expired to
storage server.  The storage server will allow clients that set
x-backend-open-expired to open and read an object even after the
x-delete-at time as passed.

During the period after an object is expired, but before it has been
reaped by the object-expirer this new feature will be helpful for
recovery of encrypted or EC data.

Change-Id: Ibe7dde0e3bf587d77e14808b169c02f8fb3dddb3
"}, {'number': 18, 'created': '2023-03-21 15:01:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/db322ce59b74de8a640c8d5b3d6b8360a99588d0', 'message': "Add X-Open-Expired to recover expired objects

"}, {'number': 28, 'created': '2024-03-05 19:32:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/f88bf1a79e4c2620ddc0ba1be373da3249c09580', 'message': "add x-open-expired to access expired objects with global config flag

If the global configuration option 'enable_open_expired' is set
to true in the config, then the client will be able to make a
request with the header 'x-open-expired' set to true in order
to retrieve an object that has expired (it is in its grace period).
If this config flag is set to false, the client will not be able
to access any expired objects, even with the header, which is the
default behavior unless the flag is set.

When a client sets a 'x-open-expired' header to a true value for a
GET/HEAD/POST request the proxy will forward x-backend-open-expired to
storage server. The storage server will allow clients that set
x-backend-open-expired to open and read an object even after the
x-delete-at time as passed.

During the period after an object is expired, but before it has been
reaped by the object-expirer this new feature will be helpful for
recovery of encrypted or EC data.

This feature is not enabled on temporary URLs.

Change-Id: Ibe7dde0e3bf587d77e14808b169c02f8fb3dddb3

If the global configuration option 'enable_open_expired' is set
to true in the config, then the client will be able to make a
request with the header 'x-open-expired' set to true in order
to retrieve an object that has expired (it is in its grace period).

to access any expired objects, even with the header, which is the

"}, {'number': 34, 'created': '2024-03-18 21:56:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/82ccaa2a6610f196ff6fcb2bc6004def5e361bb3', 'message': "support x-open-expired header for expired objects

If the global configuration option 'enable_open_expired' is set
to true in the config, then the client will be able to make a
request with the header 'x-open-expired' set to true in order
to access an object that has expired, provided it is in its
grace period. If this config flag is set to false, the client
will not be able to access any expired objects, even with the
header, which is the default behavior unless the flag is set.

When a client sets a 'x-open-expired' header to a true value for a
GET/HEAD/POST request the proxy will forward x-backend-open-expired to
storage server. The storage server will allow clients that set
x-backend-open-expired to open and read an object that has not yet
been reaped by the object-expirer, even after the x-delete-at time
has passed.

The header is always ignored when used with temporary URLs.

Related-Change: I106103438c4162a561486ac73a09436e998ae1f0
Change-Id: Ibe7dde0e3bf587d77e14808b169c02f8fb3dddb3

"}, {'number': 38, 'created': '2024-03-21 00:16:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/96de55d73acec42637aac9e93e75342eac8159d6', 'message': "support x-open-expired header for expired objects

If the global configuration option 'enable_open_expired' is set
to true in the config, then the client will be able to make a
request with the header 'x-open-expired' set to true in order
to access an object that has expired, provided it is in its
grace period. If this config flag is set to false, the client
will not be able to access any expired objects, even with the
header, which is the default behavior unless the flag is set.

When a client sets a 'x-open-expired' header to a true value for a
GET/HEAD/POST request the proxy will forward x-backend-open-expired to
storage server. The storage server will allow clients that set
x-backend-open-expired to open and read an object that has not yet
been reaped by the object-expirer, even after the x-delete-at time
has passed.

The header is always ignored when used with temporary URLs.

Co-Authored-By: Anish Kachinthaya <akachinthaya@nvidia.com>
Related-Change: I106103438c4162a561486ac73a09436e998ae1f0
Change-Id: Ibe7dde0e3bf587d77e14808b169c02f8fb3dddb3

request with the header 'x-open-expired' set to true in order
to access an object that has expired, provided it is in its
grace period. If this config flag is set to false, the client
will not be able to access any expired objects, even with the
header, which is the default behavior unless the flag is set.

When a client sets a 'x-open-expired' header to a true value for a
GET/HEAD/POST request the proxy will forward x-backend-open-expired to
storage server. The storage server will allow clients that set
x-backend-open-expired to open and read an object that has not yet
been reaped by the object-expirer, even after the x-delete-at time
has passed.

The header is always ignored when used with temporary URLs.

Co-Authored-By: Anish Kachinthaya <akachinthaya@nvidia.com>
Related-Change: I106103438c4162a561486ac73a09436e998ae1f0
Change-Id: Ibe7dde0e3bf587d77e14808b169c02f8fb3dddb3
"}]
commit_message:
support x-open-expired header for expired objects

If the global configuration option 'enable_open_expired' is set
to true in the config, then the client will be able to make a
request with the header 'x-open-expired' set to true in order
to access an object that has expired, provided it is in its
grace period. If this config flag is set to false, the client
will not be able to access any expired objects, even with the
header, which is the default behavior unless the flag is set.

When a client sets a 'x-open-expired' header to a true value for a
GET/HEAD/POST request the proxy will forward x-backend-open-expired to
storage server. The storage server will allow clients that set
x-backend-open-expired to open and read an object that has not yet
been reaped by the object-expirer, even after the x-delete-at time
has passed.

The header is always ignored when used with temporary URLs.

Co-Authored-By: Anish Kachinthaya <akachinthaya@nvidia.com>
Related-Change: I106103438c4162a561486ac73a09436e998ae1f0
Change-Id: Ibe7dde0e3bf587d77e14808b169c02f8fb3dddb3

commit_message:
Allow tags to be passed through to compute.create_server

Setting tags on servers is useful for managing sets of related resources
(e.g., we're spawning JupyterHub instances in OpenStack and we want to
tag all servers created by our spawner to make it easier to clean things
up).

This commit configures the create_server method to accept the tags
keyword paramter and pass it through to compute.create_server.

Change-Id: I92a449e584f9912f2bff86939e3565c6b3001bb9

commit_message:
image: Pass correct stores argument

Change I3b897abccfecf9353be07abc8f8325d91f3eb9d4 introduced support for
multiple image stores. Unfortunately a typo was included that has been
carried forward since. Correct the mistake now and add a test to prevent
regressions.

Change-Id: I4d2c81d19d295aae8a77007a1c7de7083d061f24
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
